thread.title: The main reason this walk could not occur today
thread.title_full: The main reason this walk could not occur today - The Washington Post

author: washingtonpost.com
title: The main reason this walk could not occur today
text:
October 9 at 7:42 PM Ann Hornaday’s Oct. 2 review of “The Walk,” a film about a high-wire artist who walked between the twin towers of the World Trade Center in 1974, had a sentence that concluded, “even if both [James] Marsh and [Robert] Zemeckis note the grim irony that [Philippe] Petit’s free run of the towers would never be possible in the post-9/11 security state” [“ A man on a wire opens a window to the past ,” Weekend].
Did it not occur to The Post that such a stunt would also be impossible today because the twin towers no longer exist, as they were destroyed in the terror attack that also killed nearly 3,000 people and provoked the “security state”?
Jonathan F. Keiler , Bowie
